oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Uncle Tom's Cabin Young Folk's Edition
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is a post-Civil War edition of Uncle Tom's Cabin published by M.A. Donohue & Company and was intended for children. Uncle Tom's Cabin was written by Harriet Beecher Stowe in 1858 to rally support for the anti-slavery cause. This Young Folk's edition belonged to Annie Lawson Coppinger of Marion County, Tennessee. She was born in 1885 and died in 1953. Her father was a Confederate veteran of Carter's 1st Tenn. Cav.,CSA from Meigs County, Tennessee.
